result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1173 and 15CM1283 called: 1:32pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW; Written DEJ agreement.

State moves to:
15CM1173>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM1283 - Ct. 1 (Misd BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis.
  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.

COURT defers matter for a period of 1 year for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.

DEOJ RH>> 9/30/16 at 8:30am
Bond continues.

Adj: 1:40pm

No contact with victim(s): P.S. OR co-defendant(s): K.C., W.M., &  A.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No controlled substances w/o valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
